listing.listing_description: This unit is in close proximity to an ongoing construction project. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist.Alpenglow Villa is a gorgeous home at Big Sky Ski Resort in Montana, situated just steps from the groomed ski slopes at Lewis Clark lift. Secluded on a private estate near Spanish Peaks Mountain Club, the 5,250-square-foot villa gazes out on breathtaking views of Wilson Peak and the Spanish Peaks Range from its ample outdoor living spaces and beautiful interiors. Exceptional private amenities for relaxation and dining include an outdoor hot tub, gourmet kitchen, pool table, and high-end media features. Four large bedrooms plus a kid-friendly bunkroom accommodate sixteen guests, ideal for families and large groups of friends. At extra cost, guests enjoys access to the world-class amenities at Spanish Peaks Mountain Club.The villa's living room exudes a quintessential alpine charm, with high, peaked ceilings, natural wood paneling, and a superb stone hearth with wood-burning fireplace. A large threshold leads into the dining room with table for eight, from which glass French doors open to a deck with barbeque grill and alfresco dining. The open kitchen features chef-grade appliances (including a stainless steel 6-burner Themador range and dual oven), as well as a walk-in pantry and a large breakfast bar.Downstairs, the game room welcomes playful downtime between adventures on the mountain, with a pool table, mini-bar, lounge, and flat-screen TV, while the hot tub on the lower patio beckons you into its soothing waters. The villa also features a home office.The master suites, on the main level, features a fireplace and balcony with sweeping mountain views, while its ensuite bathroom includes a deep soaking tub beside a picture window. A king guestroom is secluded on the upper level, with access to a hallway bathroom, and there are three guest suites with ensuite bathrooms on the lower level: one with a king bed, one with a queen bed, and a kids' room with three bunk beds.From the villa's custom-built ski storage room, you're about fifty feet from the slopes near Lewis Clark lift. Spanish Peaks Clubhouse is just four minutes away, featuring a resort-style pool and eighteen-hole championship golf course designed by Tom Weiskopf, among other amenities. The Big Sky Resort base and town center are within easy reach.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Once a vacation home of the Disney family, this A-list Spanish colonial villa is one of Palm Spring's finest. Work on your tan within the private walls of the backyard while the kids splash around in the pool. Dine alfresco beneath the shade of mature palm trees. Rather eat out? Wander down Warm Sand, and you’ll find plenty of options for dinner and drinks.Recently renovated, The Roy Disney House shows off all the trademark styles of the Spanish colonial era. From the tiled-roof to the wood-floor, with exposed-beams and wrought-iron in between, this house is equal parts elegant and earthy. The farmhouse kitchen’s rustic-chic picnic table is perfect for a family breakfast, while the alfresco dining area sets the mood for an unforgettable dinner. After you’ve eaten, mix up a few tropical cocktails and gather around the fire pit with old friends.Palm Springs is packed with PGA-caliber golf courses, many within 20-miles of home. After a beer at the clubhouse, head to downtown Palm Springs for a quick snack with the rest of the group. Palm Canyon Drive is packed with cafes, boutique bakeries, and a few fantastic bagel shops. You’ll find a wide range of trendy bars and delicious restaurants on Palm Canyon as well. And, if you’re into vintage clothes shopping, you’re going to love the Desert Cities.Palm Springs City ID: 406Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Colorado’s famous powder is at your doorstep at Snowline Ridge 307. Set on the Stampede run at Steamboat Ski Resort, this ground-floor Steamboat Springs vacation rental gives you direct access to the slopes. Luxury amenities at the Edgemont community, snug yet stylish interiors and four bedrooms give the villa an irresistible combination of convenience and charm.Guests of the Edgemont complex are invited to use the shared heated outdoor pool and hot tub during their holidays. If you can’t get enough of the fresh mountain air, heat up the barbecue on the villa’s private deck for dinner or gather around the al-fresco fireplace to roast marshmallows. Inside, leave your gear in the villa’s dedicated ski storage area and cozy up to the fireplace and flat-screen television with a glass from the wine cooler.Rich earth tones, stone and wood textures and an open-plan great room give the interiors of Snowline Ridge 307 a modern feel that’s rooted in traditional mountain style. There’s plenty of room to gather the whole family on the sofas in the sitting area, around the live-edge dining table or on the bar-height benches at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen.The property has three bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms: a master suite with a king bed and fireplace that opens to its own deck, a second bedroom with a king bed, and a bedroom with a queen bed, mountain views and deck access. The fourth bedroom has bunk beds, opens to the deck and shares a hall bathroom.While you could spend your stay on the ski trails right outside, it’s worth exploring the Steamboat Springs area. Take the complimentary seasonal shuttle to discover the shopping and dining options in the close-by mountain village. Don’t miss the area’s hot springs, from the family-friendly Old Town to the relive-your-honeymoon pools at Strawberry Park. The snow may melt in the summer, but the town heats up with enough golf, kayaking, rafting, fishing, hiking and more to fill any visitor’s schedule.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Easily one of Deer Valley’s most luxurious vacation homes, Sky Ridge Retreat offer an endless supply of amenities, a gorgeous atmosphere, and ample space for your large group. With six amazing bedrooms, Sky Ridge has accommodations for twenty-one, making it perfect for a larger scale family event or corporate retreat. At Sky Ridge, Deer Valley ski access is just steps from the front door and the mountain views are endless.From the massive stone fireplace of the great room, to the checkered floor of the movie theatre’s concession, Sky Ridge is gorgeous and dynamic. Stone, wood, and plenty of mountain framing windows set a luxurious alpine tone throughout the estate. Plush designer furniture and spacious rooms, lit by bright chandeliers, create a warm and inviting atmosphere. In a vacation home with accommodations for twenty-one, space is important. Sky Ridge does a great job of making sure each common space has enough room for the whole group, as does the kitchen, which is essentially two high-end kitchens in one.On the multi-level terrace, views of Jordanelle Lake and the ski slopes can be seen from outdoor living spaces as well as the twenty-person hot tub. After you’ve warmed up in the hot tub, head back inside and settle in for a movie night in the home theatre, complete with a fifties style concession area. Or, if you’ve still got some energy after a long day on the slopes, challenge a friend to a game of billiards, ping pong, or foosball.Sky Ridge’s first six bedrooms feature either a king or queen sized bed and en-suite bathrooms. The final bedroom has three sets of bunk beds and an en-suite, making it great for kids and extra guests.Aside from the world-class skiing of Deer Valley, Park City is home to plenty of great parks, golf courses, shops, and restaurants. Check the local concert listings as well because this quaint ski town also boasts a pretty vibrant nightlife.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Relax beside the fireplace and recount stories of an exciting day on the mountain while you gaze upon it from this modern-ski lodge in Ketchum. Rejuvenate in the hot tub before dinner, and then rejoin the group at the formal dining table. Then, compose some after-dinner music on the piano or rally the troops for a night out in Ketchum. Sawtooth Brewery has a great selection of local craft brews. Hygge House is a fresh take on the traditional ski-lodge, borrowing design elements from the Danish, and mixing them with familiar Mid-Century modern decor. Flow from the fireplace lounge to the kitchen’s bar, and on to the dining area, all while enjoying the mountain view. Warm wood tones set the kitchen apart from the rest of the interior. Downstairs, the kids will love the family room’s cozy vibe. On nights in, Hygge House is ready to host. Turn up the sound system, pick a bottle from the wine fridge, and organize a pool tournament in the game room. After, put the big game on the television and cheer on your team in the living room. When it’s late, take the all-nighters out to the hot tub and enjoy the stars while you finish off your evening. Within 8 miles, you’ll have access to skiing at Dollar Mountain, River Run, and Bald Mountain. In the summer, the course at Elkhorn Golf Club is a great way to explore the rugged mountain landscape. The kids will love Magic Lantern Cinema and the ice skating rink at Atkinson Park. And, the older kids will appreciate Elkhorn’s vibrant nightlife. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Set off for mountain adventures year-round from Snowy Point Chalet. Whether it’s summer or winter, this Breckenridge vacation rental puts you close to some of the best hiking and skiing in Colorado, plus shopping and dining in town. The villa’s 3,500 square feet and four bedrooms mean you can invite up to ten friends or a group of extended family.If you’re visiting during the summer, enjoy the fresh mountain air from a deck with a barbecue, sound system and al-fresco dining for four, or a terrace with an outdoor hot tub. If you’re here to ski, unwind after a day on the slopes in the media room, around the wet bar or at the foosball table. Other amenities range from cable TV and Wi-Fi to laundry facilities.The heart of this luxury chalet is a classic mountain-lodge-style great room with vaulted ceilings, wood beams, floor-to-ceiling windows and a massive stone fireplace. Stretch out on a pair of leather sofas in front of the hearth (and TV), relive the day’s adventures over a snack at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen or plan the next ones around the dining table.Snowy Point Chalet has two bedrooms with king beds and private en-suite bathrooms, including a honeymoon-suite-inspired master bedroom with a jetted tub, and one bedroom with a king bed and shared bathroom. The fourth bedroom has a twin-over queen bunk bed plus a twin trundle bed and an en-suite bathroom.During the summer, you can set off on hiking trails from your own backyard or even head into town, a 10-minute walk downhill. During the winter, it’s a short walk to the 4 O’Clock ski run and a 5-minute drive into the town of Breckenridge. No matter when your holiday, you’re close to outdoor activities, spectacular scenery, and convenient shopping and dining.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: There’s no better place to watch the big game, or play one yourself, than this exciting entertainment paradise in Scottsdale. Shoot a round of mini-golf, pool, or cornhole; the list goes on-and-on. There’s even a playground for the kids. After all the activity, relax with a soothing soak in the hot tub. Then, head out for a little bar hopping 9-miles from home in Scottsdale’s Old Town.Before you head out for the night, sit with old friends at the wet bar for a beer while the chef in your group whips up a quick snack in the spacious kitchen at the opposite end of the open-concept living room. Not quite ready to go? Stay in and organize a poker tournament, throw a pool party, or find a partner for a game of doubles pickleball. If you’re keeping up with your fitness routine on vacation, you’ve come to the right place. There’s also a home gym. Scottsdale is a haven for people who love the outdoors. Hiking and cycling are great ways to enjoy the rugged environment and snap a few gorgeous landscape photos. The McDowell Sonoran Preserve has over 100-miles of hiking trails to explore. After warming up on the putting green, head out to one of the many desert golf courses in the area. Later, do a little shopping, sit for dinner, or hit the bars at Scottsdale’s coolest new entertainment area, the Kierland Commons.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: No matter what season you visit Deer Valley there’s always plenty of excitement to go around in this adventure tourism mecca. Golf, mountain biking, hiking, and skiing are not just fun activities in Park City, they are a way of life. This five bedroom luxury villa is the perfect home base for your family’s most exhilarating vacation yet.When one thinks of a traditional ski lodge, things like timber framing, rustic wood and leather furniture, a roaring fireplace, and epic mountain views come to mind. Deer Valley has all that, but it also has extra high vaulted ceilings, state of the art appliances, and a modern open concept layout. The lounge area is the ideal spot to relax after an adventurous day, with cozy seating, a wet bar, and a television over top of the fireplace, it’s a warm inviting space to stretch out and recount the stories of the day.Start your morning off with an espresso at the breakfast bar before you hit the slopes. For lunch, head back home for a barbecue on the balcony, there’s outdoor furniture to sit at, or you can come back inside and make use of the formal dining area. Before you head back out, make sure to put your boots on the boot dryer. And while your waiting, play a game of billiards, relax in the sauna, watch some satellite television, or take a break in the steam room. When it’s time to retire for the evening, there are four bedrooms with king sized beds and en-suite bathrooms. The fifth bedroom has a queen bed and shared access to the hallway bathroom.Just minutes outside your door, you’ll find the chairlifts of Deer Valley, Park City, and Canyons Resorts, truly some of the best skiing on the planet. If you walk a little further, you’ll find Historic Main Street, a vibrant little mountain town with boutique shops, restaurants and cafes, and picturesque mountain scenery.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
